pwn.name: CorServices Analyzer
pwn.desc:
ryaagard
Our new program to analyze PE files!

File parsing is historically hard to get right, but we solved it here at CorServices and our Analyzer is definitely safe to use. You can even read the code and make sure yourself.

The challenge is run on a Windows 10 machine, knowing the exact version is not intended or required to solve this challenge.

pwn.name: CorServices Defender
pwn.desc:
ryaagard
After releasing our Analyzer we received a lot of malware samples to analyze, so it only made sense to start developing our own antivirus solution.

Defender will protect your Windows system from cyber threats and prevent malicious actors from stealing your ctf exploits. It's currently in active development so some features will be missing, but here at CorServices we are dedicated and (hard) at work to finish it as soon as possible.

Download a Windows VM image with Defender pre-installed here!

pwn.name: frogcompute
pwn.desc:
maxster
The Frog Software Foundation is offering PaaS solutions for developers.

pwn.name: hangbuzz101
pwn.desc:
FizzBuzz101
While other VR firms find real 0-days, we only find random "hangs"!

Hint: Take a look at net/sched and tc

Note that the kernel is built with the config below at commit of: 8742b2d8935f

We patch it with the following command:

sed -i "s/BUG: soft lockup/BUG: soft lockup, here is your flag: ${FLAG}/g" kernel/watchdog.c

pwn.name: zenerational aura
pwn.desc:
FizzBuzz101
amd vibes only 🔥 called corctf\_crash kernel folded under zero pressure 🗿 zenerational aura loss 💀 couldnt rizz up ring3 🥀 gotta farm that zenerational aura wealth to root ✨

Note that the kernel is built with the config below at commit of: 8742b2d8935f

The challenge is hosted on an EPYC 7502P (Zen 2 generation).

web.name: corctf challenge dev 2
web.desc:
drakon
The Crusaders of Rust Online Challenge Development Portal is back and ~~better than ever~~ mostly unchanged! I didn't have time to update the website, since fizzbuzz101 ordered me to update his censorship extension.

I rewrote the whole thing. Check it out!

web.name: msbugs revenge
web.desc:
jazzpizazz
It seems like our previous version was overly vulnerable. We dumped our app into an LLM and asked it to improve our security. It made all kinds of changes, but this sure as hell does not look vulnerable anymore :D

web.name: vouched
web.desc:
jazzpizazz
